page.title: 16SETTLEMENT
page.content: THE VILLAGES OF HORSFORD AND FELTHORPE ARE ANCIENT SETTLEMENTS. THEY REMAINED SMALL VILLAGES FOR HUNDREDS OF YEARS. HORSFORD WAS A CROSSING POINT ON THE ROUTE TO NORWICH. THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE MOTOR CAR CHANGED ITS FUNCTION AND THE SIZE OF THE VILLAGE . MOST PEOPLE WORK IN NORWICH AND USE CARS FOR TRANSPORT,THE VILLAGES HAVE BECOME DORMITORIES. ACCESS TO THE MAIN ROAD HAS BEEN IMPORTANT SO DEVELOPMENT HAS TAKEN PLACE ALONG IT, (RIBBON DEVELOPMENT). THE COMMUNITES ARE MODERATELY WELL SERVED BY LOCAL SHOPS AND THERE ARE LARGE STORES IN NORWICH. THERE ARE PLAYING FIELDS, VILLAGE HALLS, CHURCHES AND PUBS IN BOTH VILLAGES. IN THESE, MANY COMMUNITY EVENTS TAKE PLACE. ALTHOUGH THERE ARE A FEW OLDER BUILDINGS, THE GREATER MAJORITY ARE LESS THAN 20 YEARS OLD.
